page.title: 13WILDLIFE OF BARLING
page.content: Barling is a good place for wildlife. There are many different kinds of birds to be found here. Many marshland birds, ducks and geese come to the creeks particularly in winter. There is often a kestrel hovering over the fields. There is a heronry in Barling. This year it had 4 nests. When we went there we found some bones. We saw a baby heron being fed. Lee and Ryan saw one eating an eel. In 1982 many herons were killed by farmers because they ate their fish. The R.S.P.B. wished to protect the birds. They made a survey and found that by making the banks of the fish lakes vertical it would make the herons leave them alone as they like to wade in shallow water. Barling is also good place to find animals like foxes. There is even a coypu near the creek.
